intro: Aphragmus oxycarpus, commonly known as the sharp-fruited mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It grows on a variety of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are typically red or orange, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. The plant's unique botanical features make it an important component of its ecological community.
